lead_paragraph: Mino Auletta, an Italian lawyer, was elected the president of the Court of Arbitration for Sport, defeating the former World Anti-Doping Agency chief Dick Pound. Auletta, the acting president of the court, said by telephone from Monaco that he received a majority of the votes at a meeting of the court’s governing body. Auletta will oversee the appointment of arbitrators for the sports world’s top appeals body.
